intro: Endiandra microneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The leaves are typically elliptical with prominent, parallel veins, and the plant produces small, yellowish-white fruits. It is often found in lowland and hill forests, growing in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
